File 'PlatypusTools.ps1' uses Write-Host. Avoid using Write-Host because it might not work in all hosts, does not work when there is no host, and (prior to PS 5.0) cannot be suppressed, captured, or redirected. Instead, use Write-Output, Write-Verbose, or Write-Information.

StartScriptPosition.Line: try { Add-Content -Path $logPath -Value "$(Get-Date -Format 'u') ERROR: $message" -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue } catch { Write-Host "Failed to write log to ${logPath}: $message" -ForegroundColor Yellow }

EndScriptPosition.Line: try { Add-Content -Path $logPath -Value "$(Get-Date -Format 'u') ERROR: $message" -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue } catch { Write-Host "Failed to write log to ${logPath}: $message" -ForegroundColor Yellow }

Extent.Text: Write-Host "Failed to write log to ${logPath}: $message" -ForegroundColor Yellow
